intro: Leucosyke hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy leucosyke, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrowly lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Leucosyke hispidissima is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and harsh environmental conditions.
